intro: Cyclobalanopsis xiangxiensis, commonly known as the Xiangxiensis evergreen oak, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. This plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and produces small, oval-shaped acorns. It typically grows in mountainous regions with high humidity and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
